page.shortlink: ux list builder list properties reverse column order
page.description: For Lists that are rendered right-to-left, you can specify that the column order for Column layouts should be reversed.
page.discussion: By default, columns in a List control using a Column layout are rendred from left-to-right. If you are using a right-to-left language (such as Hebrew), then you might want the columns in a Column layout to be rendered in the reverse order. Checking the *[ui:Reverse column order]* property will render the columns in the List from right-to-left.

section.title: How to Render Columns in a List with a Column Layout from Right-to-Left

step.description: To enable reversed column order, check the *[ui:Reverse column order]* property. The *[ui:Reverse column order]* property can be found in the *[ui:Advanced]* section of the *[ui:List Properties]* pane in the List Builder.

Once *[ui:Reverse column order]* is enabled, the List will render the columns from right-to-left. You can quickly verify the new layout by clicking the *[ui:Preview List]* button located in the lower left-hand corner of the List Builder.
step.note: *[ui:Reverse column order]* only applies to Column layouts in the List control.
